trans-unit.source: Avoid duplicate accelerators
trans-unit.target: Avoid duplicate accelerators

trans-unit.source: An access key, also known as an accelerator, enables keyboard access to a control by using the ALT key. When multiple controls have duplicate access keys, the behavior of the access key is not well defined.
trans-unit.target: An access key, also known as an accelerator, enables keyboard access to a control by using the ALT key. When multiple controls have duplicate access keys, the behavior of the access key is not well defined.

trans-unit.source: Avoid duplicate accelerators
trans-unit.target: Avoid duplicate accelerators

trans-unit.source: Set locale for data types
trans-unit.target: Set locale for data types

trans-unit.source: The locale determines culture-specific presentation elements for data, such as formatting that is used for numeric values, currency symbols, and sort order. When you create a DataTable or DataSet, you should explicitly set the locale.
trans-unit.target: The locale determines culture-specific presentation elements for data, such as formatting that is used for numeric values, currency symbols, and sort order. When you create a DataTable or DataSet, you should explicitly set the locale.

trans-unit.source: Set locale for data types
trans-unit.target: Set locale for data types

trans-unit.source: Do not mark serviced components with WebMethod
trans-unit.target: Do not mark serviced components with WebMethod

trans-unit.source: A method in a type that inherits from System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent is marked by using System.Web.Services.WebMethodAttribute. Because WebMethodAttribute and a ServicedComponent method have conflicting behavior and requirements for context and transaction flow, the behavior of the method will be incorrect in some scenarios.
trans-unit.target: A method in a type that inherits from System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent is marked by using System.Web.Services.WebMethodAttribute. Because WebMethodAttribute and a ServicedComponent method have conflicting behavior and requirements for context and transaction flow, the behavior of the method will be incorrect in some scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Do not mark serviced components with WebMethod
trans-unit.target: Do not mark serviced components with WebMethod

trans-unit.source: Call base class methods on ISerializable types
trans-unit.target: Call base class methods on ISerializable types

trans-unit.source: To fix a violation of this rule, call the base type GetObjectData method or serialization constructor from the corresponding derived type method or constructor.
trans-unit.target: To fix a violation of this rule, call the base type GetObjectData method or serialization constructor from the corresponding derived type method or constructor.

trans-unit.source: Call base class methods on ISerializable types
trans-unit.target: Call base class methods on ISerializable types

trans-unit.source: Do Not Catch Corrupted State Exceptions
trans-unit.target: Do Not Catch Corrupted State Exceptions

trans-unit.source: Catching corrupted state exceptions could mask errors (such as access violations), resulting in inconsistent state of execution or making it easier for attackers to compromise system. Instead, catch and handle a more specific set of exception type(s) or re-throw the exception.
trans-unit.target: Catching corrupted state exceptions could mask errors (such as access violations), resulting in inconsistent state of execution or making it easier for attackers to compromise system. Instead, catch and handle a more specific set of exception type(s) or re-throw the exception.

trans-unit.source: {0} is catching corrupted state exception
trans-unit.target: {0} is catching corrupted state exception

trans-unit.source: Types should not extend certain base types
trans-unit.target: Types should not extend certain base types

trans-unit.source: An externally visible type extends certain base types. Use one of the alternatives.
trans-unit.target: An externally visible type extends certain base types. Use one of the alternatives.

trans-unit.source: Change the base type of {0} so that it no longer extends {1}. The preferred design is to decouple the underlying XmlDocument representation from the type's interface by using containment instead of inheritance.
trans-unit.target: Change the base type of {0} so that it no longer extends {1}. The preferred design is to decouple the underlying XmlDocument representation from the type's interface by using containment instead of inheritance.

trans-unit.source: Change the base type of {0} so that it no longer extends {1}. This base exception type does not provide any additional value for framework classes. Extend 'System.Exception' or an existing unsealed exception type instead. Do not create a new exception base type unless there is specific value in enabling the creation of a catch handler for an entire class of exceptions.
trans-unit.target: Change the base type of {0} so that it no longer extends {1}. This base exception type does not provide any additional value for framework classes. Extend 'System.Exception' or an existing unsealed exception type instead. Do not create a new exception base type unless there is specific value in enabling the creation of a catch handler for an entire class of exceptions.

trans-unit.target: Change the base type of {0} from {1} to its generic equivalent 'System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection'.

trans-unit.source: Using XmlTextReader.Load(), creating an insecure XmlReaderSettings instance when invoking XmlReader.Create(), setting the InnerXml property of the XmlDocument and enabling DTD processing using XmlUrlResolver insecurely can lead to information disclosure. Replace it with a call to the Load() method overload that takes an XmlReader instance, use XmlReader.Create() to accept XmlReaderSettings arguments or consider explicitly setting secure values. The DataViewSettingCollectionString property of DataViewManager should always be assigned from a trusted source, the DtdProcessing property should be set to false, and the XmlResolver property should be changed to XmlSecureResolver or null.
trans-unit.target: Using XmlTextReader.Load(), creating an insecure XmlReaderSettings instance when invoking XmlReader.Create(), setting the InnerXml property of the XmlDocument and enabling DTD processing using XmlUrlResolver insecurely can lead to information disclosure. Replace it with a call to the Load() method overload that takes an XmlReader instance, use XmlReader.Create() to accept XmlReaderSettings arguments or consider explicitly setting secure values. The DataViewSettingCollectionString property of DataViewManager should always be assigned from a trusted source, the DtdProcessing property should be set to false, and the XmlResolver property should be changed to XmlSecureResolver or null.

trans-unit.source: Unsafe overload of '{0}' method
trans-unit.target: Unsafe overload of '{0}' method

trans-unit.source: Uses the unsafe setter of InnerXml property of System.Xml.XmlDocument.
trans-unit.target: Uses the unsafe setter of InnerXml property of System.Xml.XmlDocument.

trans-unit.source: Insecure DTD processing in XML
trans-unit.target: Insecure DTD processing in XML

trans-unit.source: Property in {0} might be set from an untrusted source.
trans-unit.target: Property in {0} might be set from an untrusted source.

trans-unit.source: An XmlDocument instance is created without setting its XmlResolver property to a secure value
trans-unit.target: An XmlDocument instance is created without setting its XmlResolver property to a secure value

trans-unit.source: An insecure XmlReaderSettings instance is provided to XmlReader.Create method.
trans-unit.target: An insecure XmlReaderSettings instance is provided to XmlReader.Create method.

trans-unit.source: A potentially insecure XmlReaderSettings instance is provided to XmlReader.Create method.
trans-unit.target: A potentially insecure XmlReaderSettings instance is provided to XmlReader.Create method.

trans-unit.source: An insecure overload of XmlReader.Create which does not accept an XmlReaderSettings argument.
trans-unit.target: An insecure overload of XmlReader.Create which does not accept an XmlReaderSettings argument.

trans-unit.source: XmlTextReader instance created with insecure default settings.
trans-unit.target: XmlTextReader instance created with insecure default settings.

trans-unit.source: XmlTextReader instance is set with insecure values.
trans-unit.target: XmlTextReader instance is set with insecure values.

trans-unit.source: Insecure Processing in API Design, XmlDocument and XmlTextReader
trans-unit.target: Insecure Processing in API Design, XmlDocument and XmlTextReader

trans-unit.source: Enabling DTD processing on all instances derived from XmlTextReader or XmlDocument and using XmlUrlResolver for resolving external XML entities may lead to information disclosure. Ensure to set the XmlResolver property to null, create an instance of XmlSecureResolver when processing untrusted input, or use XmlReader.Create method with a secure XmlReaderSettings argument. Unless you need to enable it, ensure the DtdProcessing property is set to false.
trans-unit.target: Enabling DTD processing on all instances derived from XmlTextReader or XmlDocument and using XmlUrlResolver for resolving external XML entities may lead to information disclosure. Ensure to set the XmlResolver property to null, create an instance of XmlSecureResolver when processing untrusted input, or use XmlReader.Create method with a secure XmlReaderSettings argument. Unless you need to enable it, ensure the DtdProcessing property is set to false.

trans-unit.source: Constructor of XmlDocument derived class {0} implicitly uses insecure default value for DTD processing.
trans-unit.target: Constructor of XmlDocument derived class {0} implicitly uses insecure default value for DTD processing.

trans-unit.source: XmlDocument derived class {0} doesn't explicitly define a constructor.
trans-unit.target: XmlDocument derived class {0} doesn't explicitly define a constructor.

trans-unit.source: Method {0} of XmlDocument derived class sets XmlResolver property to an insecure value.
trans-unit.target: Method {0} of XmlDocument derived class sets XmlResolver property to an insecure value.

trans-unit.source: Constructor of XmlTextReader derived class {0} uses insecure default values for DTD processing.
trans-unit.target: Constructor of XmlTextReader derived class {0} uses insecure default values for DTD processing.

trans-unit.source: XmlTextReader derived class {0} doesn't explicitly define a constructor.
trans-unit.target: XmlTextReader derived class {0} doesn't explicitly define a constructor.

trans-unit.source: {0} method of XmlTextReader derived class sets XmlResolver and/or DtdProcessing property to insecure value.
trans-unit.target: {0} method of XmlTextReader derived class sets XmlResolver and/or DtdProcessing property to insecure value.

trans-unit.source: Insecure XSLT script processing
trans-unit.target: Insecure XSLT script processing

trans-unit.source: Providing an insecure XsltSettings instance and an insecure XmlResolver instance to XslCompiledTransform.Load method is potentially unsafe as it allows processing script within XSL, which on an untrusted XSL input may lead to malicious code execution. Either replace the insecure XsltSettings argument with XsltSettings.Default or an instance that has disabled document function and script execution, or replace the XmlResolver argument with null or an XmlSecureResolver instance. This message may be suppressed if the input is known to be from a trusted source and external resource resolution from locations that are not known in advance must be supported.
trans-unit.target: Providing an insecure XsltSettings instance and an insecure XmlResolver instance to XslCompiledTransform.Load method is potentially unsafe as it allows processing script within XSL, which on an untrusted XSL input may lead to malicious code execution. Either replace the insecure XsltSettings argument with XsltSettings.Default or an instance that has disabled document function and script execution, or replace the XmlResolver argument with null or an XmlSecureResolver instance. This message may be suppressed if the input is known to be from a trusted source and external resource resolution from locations that are not known in advance must be supported.

trans-unit.source: In {0} an insecure combination of XsltSettings and XmlResolver instances are provided to XslCompiledTransfor.Load as arguments.
trans-unit.target: In {0} an insecure combination of XsltSettings and XmlResolver instances are provided to XslCompiledTransfor.Load as arguments.

trans-unit.source: In {0} an insecure combination of XsltSettings and XmlResolver instances are provided to XslCompiledTransfor.Load as arguments.
trans-unit.target: In {0} an insecure combination of XsltSettings and XmlResolver instances are provided to XslCompiledTransfor.Load as arguments.

trans-unit.target: The ValidateAntiForgeryAttribute is defined with HttpVerbs.Get and at least one of HttpVerbs.Post, HttpVerbs.Put, HttpVerbs.Delete, or HttpVerbs.Patch on controller action {0}. The attribute will not be used when GET verb is used.
